faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The subject focuses on helping students develop a personal life plan that aligns with their values, goals, and aspirations. The course is built on design thinking methodologies and double diamond model in particular. At the end of the subject, the learner is consciously ready to shape his/her/their career and working life, is able to set goals both in his/her/their personal life and in his professional life, and has a clear vision of how to achieve these goals.
description.et: Aine keskendub üliõpilaste abistamisele isikliku eluplaani väljatöötamisel, mis on kooskõlas nende väärtuste, eesmärkide ja püüdlustega. Õpitakse enesejuhtimise tööriistade rakendamist ning kursus on rajatud disainmõtlemisele ning eelkõige kahekordse teemandi meetodile. Aine lõpuks on õppija teadlikult valmis oma karjääri ning tööelu kujundada, suudab seada eesmärke nii isiklikus elus kui ka tööelus ning omab selget nägemust, kuidas neid eesmärke täita.

objectives.en: The purpose of the subject is to equip the students with self-management tools and explore them in practice.
objectives.et: Õppeaine eesmärk on anda ülevaade võimalikest enesejuhtimise tööriistadest ning õppida neid oma elus rakendama.

learning_outcomes.en: The student: *develops an understanding of personal values, goals and aspirations; *has acquired skills and tools for self-development; *applies learned methods to personal and professional challenges *is able to adapt to changes and make informed decisions; *can set goals and plan ways to fulfill them.
learning_outcomes.et: Üliõpilane: *arendab välja arusaama isiklikest väärtustest, eesmärkidest ja püüdlustest; *on omandanud oskused ja tööriistad enesearenguks; *rakendab õpitud meetodeid  isiklikele ja professionaalsetele väljakutsetele *on võimeline kohanema muutustega ja tegema teadlikke otsuseid; *oskab püstitada eesmärke ning kavandada viise nende täitmiseks.

independent_work.et: Each session is structured in the form of the seminar, including an input from the lecturer, discussion and groupwork or reflection. Individual and group homeworks are based on the double diamond model, dealing with all the 4 aspects of the model one by one: discover, define, develop, deliver. Each homework includes 3 steps: practice, reading, reflection. The type of practice, reading material and reflection question will be specified during the course.

grade_preconditions.et: Participation in 4 out of 6 seminars, submitting  homework after each session (containing 3 steps: practice, reading, reflection), presenting of the final the outcome (in agreed format) of the work with the Double diamond model to the group, giving feedback to the presentations of other group members.

arvestatud.et: Participation in 4 out of 6 seminars, submission of all interim homeworks and final outcome.

mittearvestatud.et: Student did not participate in at least 4 out of 6 seminars. Student did not final outcome and/or interim homeworks.

mitteilmunud.et: Student did not attend the course.

topic.et: Welcome to the group, let´s start the journey! Presenting the project ideas, yourself as professional and learner, framing the group rules (How shall we be?), setting expectations to the course and discussing home assignment plan.

Double diamond: Discover. Explore different aspects of your project idea, look into different elements, analyse various possible contexts, let your imagination fly (focussing on innovation). Align the life plan for the study year with the idea.

Double diamond: Define. Analyse possible target groups, stakeholders, partners, networks. Work on contextualizing your idea and understanding the aspects of yourself (your competencies, practices etc) which need to be aligned and developed further.

Double diamond: Develop. Shape and frame your idea just enough for it to be tested with a selected target group. Draw an evaluation strategy which will help you analyze feedback from the testing. Test your idea, gather data, reflect and make changes.

Double diamond: Deliver. Decide on the format of presenting your developed idea and create a structure and your self-management plan in realizing the idea. Remember you (and your team) are as important as the idea itself in making it a reality.

Let's present and wrap up our journey but sustain the change! Present your project idea in a short speech, supported by relevant prompts. Receive feedback, reflect and make notes. Draw a sustainability plan to be able to realise the project long term.
Let´s check in once again, how is it going?
